normal: ^Learn how to relax ownself is important for stress and anxiety management.
main: ^(You feel a faint shadowy aura from the person, do you want to approach him?)

c-1: ^Maybe I need some time to prepare

progress1: ^...You sure are already getting used to the process
^The next moment, before the mysterious person was able to finish his sentence
^You see he turn on the monitor using a remote.
^Good afternoon and welcome to JCC news...
^The news mentioned about a famous swimming athlete has encountered an accident at a nearby swimming pool.
^The details about the incident is yet to be clarified but the athlete himself seems to be safe.
^The athlete's picture was shown on TV.
^As you look at the picture you felt a sense of DeJa vu as you feel like you seen that face somewhere.
^You then realize that the person is the one being mentioned in the news.
^You see him staring at the news not knowing what he was thinking, but you sense the shadowy aura grew.
^Doesn't seem like I am able to calm him down with my powers, it's too strong.
^Not sure what is causing such strong shadow energy.
^As you were trying to think of what to do, outside started to rain.
^You can see water splashing on the window.
^Suddenly you feel a super strong shadow energy coming from the person.
^He seems to start panicking and trying to avoid something.
^I think it's the rain causing his panic, quick go and close the curtains!
progress2: ^He seems to be trembling, trying to hide from something.

b: ^I closed the curtains, are you okay?
^You seem to be scared of something.
^He doesn't seem like feeling to talk about it.
^Looks like the only thing we can do is to find the cause from his mind.
^(I need to close the curtains first)

c-1: ^Maybe I need some time to prepare

c-0: ^You feel a strange power linking you and the person.

progress3: ^From the looks of it, that incident probably caused development of a phobia.
^Yeah, do you know what is phobia?
quiz1: ^Which of the following is the definition of phobia?
^Repeated, persistent and unwanted thoughts, urges or images that are intrusive and cause distress or anxiety.
^A persistent, excessive, unrealistic fear of an object, person, animal, activity or situation

c-0: ^This is actually the definition for obsessive compulsive disorder.
^A phobia is a persistent, excessive, unrealistic fear of an object, person, animal, activity or situation

g-0: ^Many phobias develop as a result of having a negative experience or panic attack
^Which is related to a specific object or situation.
^There may be a link between your own specific phobia and the phobia or anxiety of your parents
^This could be due to genetics or learned behavior.
^Changes in brain functioning also may play a role in developing specific phobias.

quiz3: ^Which of the following is not an example of phobia?

g-0: ^Agoraphobia is an intense fear of places that are difficult to escape
^Sometimes involving a fear of crowded or open spaces.
^Aquaphobia is an irrational fear of water.
^Acrophobia is an intense fear of heights.

quiz4: ^In this case, what could have caused his phobia

c-2: ^From what we have saw in the television, that accident may be the cause of his development of phobia.

progress4: ^What do you think we could do to help him?
^We might not be able to cure it but we can do other things to help him feel better.
^Such as relaxation method and help him understand his problem.
^?! Where am I? Aren't you the random person who helped me to close the curtains?
^Don't worry I am here to help you.
^I believe you have some unknown fear everytime you see water.
^...! H- how did you know that?
^Just like I've said before, I am here to help so trust me.
^...Doesn't seem like I am able to get away from you.
^Ok then... so how are you going to help?
^First I'll help you understand your problem.
^You explained about phobia and the possible cause of his problem.
^...So that event became my trauma and cause development of a specific phobia called aquaphobia?
^Yeah, thats why you feel fear and start to panic when you see the rain, specifically the water.
^Yeah phobia is curable, but I won't be the one doing that.
^W- why I thought you are here to help...!
^It's better to find professionals who are expert at your issue.
^Since you're at the hospital maybe you can seek professional advice.
^But still I will help you to learn how to calm down, so that you won't be too stressed.
^Well I already helped you to understand your situation.
^Lacking in awareness is one of the biggest challenge to cure mental health disorders.
^Knowing your problem and understanding that it is curable helps you to feel more rest assure right?
^Other thing I can help is by teaching you relaxation methods.
^So that you learn how to calm down youself when you start to have symptoms of phobia.
^Yeah something like quick muscle relaxation and breath focus relaxation methods.
relax1: ^Make a fist, squeezing your hand tightly.
^Hold this for a few seconds, noticing the tension.
^Close your eyes and concentrate on your breathing. Slowly breath in through your nose and out through your mouth.
^Slowly open your fingers and feel the difference – notice the tension leaving.
relax2: ^Close your eyes and concentrate on your breathing. Slowly breath in through your nose and out through your mouth.
^Hold this for a few seconds, noticing the tension.
^Slowly open your fingers and feel the difference – notice the tension leaving.
^Make a fist, squeezing your hand tightly.
relax3: ^Make a fist, squeezing your hand tightly.
^Hold this for a few seconds, noticing the tension.
^Slowly open your fingers and feel the difference – notice the tension leaving.
relax4: ^Hold this for a few seconds, noticing the tension.
^Slowly open your fingers and feel the difference – notice the tension leaving.
^He followed the instructions for a few times.
^He seems to have remembered the technique.
^Ok moving on to another technique, which would be breath focus
relax5: ^Let your breath flow as deep down into your belly as is comfortable, without forcing it.
^Try breathing in through your nose and out through your mouth.
^Breathe in gently and regularly. Some people find it helpful to count steadily from 1 to 5. You may not be able to reach 5 at first.
^Then let it flow out gently, counting from 1 to 5 again, if you find this helpful.
^Keep doing this for at least 5 minutes.
relax6: ^Let your breath flow as deep down into your belly as is comfortable, without forcing it.
^Try breathing in through your nose and out through your mouth.
^Breathe in gently and regularly. Some people find it helpful to count steadily from 1 to 5. You may not be able to reach 5 at first.
^Then let it flow out gently, counting from 1 to 5 again, if you find this helpful.
^Keep doing this for at least 5 minutes.
relax7: ^Try breathing in through your nose and out through your mouth.
^Breathe in gently and regularly. Some people find it helpful to count steadily from 1 to 5. You may not be able to reach 5 at first.
^Then let it flow out gently, counting from 1 to 5 again, if you find this helpful.
^Keep doing this for at least 5 minutes.
relax8: ^Breathe in gently and regularly. Some people find it helpful to count steadily from 1 to 5. You may not be able to reach 5 at first.
^Then let it flow out gently, counting from 1 to 5 again, if you find this helpful.
^Keep doing this for at least 5 minutes.
relax9: ^Then let it flow out gently, counting from 1 to 5 again, if you find this helpful.
^Keep doing this for at least 5 minutes.

^He seems to have remembered the technique.
^Ok good job, these technique could help you to calm down.
